model
Class AbstractPort

java.lang.Object
  model.AbstractPort
All Implemented Interfaces:
Port
Direct Known Subclasses:
ModelDriver.UsesPort, ProvidesPort
public abstract class AbstractPort
extends java.lang.Object
implements Port

This class provides a skeletal implementation of the Port interface to minimize the effort required to implement this interface. It provides the iterator methods that allow the enumeration of the terms of the view represented by this port. In addition, this abstract class handles all iterators created. A concrete implementation must provide the startIterator, size and toArray methods. In particular, the startIterator method establishes the packed iterator implementation.

The isEmpty() method is implemented using the size() method. A concrete implementation may override this method in order to increase efficiency.

The methods addTerm(Datatype key, Datatype term), getTerm(), getTerm(Datatype key), tailTerms(Datatype d) throw the UnsupportedOperationException.

Author:
Ricardo Corrï¿½a (correa@lia.ufc.br)

hasNextTerm

public boolean hasNextTerm(Datatype iteratorId)
Description copied from interface: Port
If there is a block, checks for a next term in the block. If it return false in this case, the block is released. If there is no block, checks for a next term in the model component.

The non-blocking behavior is given by the packed iteration principle

Specified by:
hasNextTerm in interface Port
Parameters:
iteratorId - the identification of a previously started iterator
Returns:
if the invocation iteratorId.equals(i) returns true for some i, then returns whether the iterator i has a next element; otherwise returns null

nextTerm

public Datatype nextTerm(Datatype iteratorId)
Description copied from interface: Port
Iterates on this set view. If a block exists and is not already completely iterated, then the next term is picked up in this block. Otherwise, the next term comes from the model component.

Specified by:
nextTerm in interface Port
Parameters:
iteratorId - the identification of a previously started iterator
Returns:
if the invocation iteratorId.equals(i) returns true for some identification i, then returns the next element on the iterator i; otherwise returns null
